Key Arguments: The right to free speech outweighs the risks the legislation aims to combat.
Some conspiracy theories have been proven correct, and removing them would prevent public scrutiny.
The government's handling of COVID-19 vaccines involved misinformation, leading to public distrust.
The legislation would prevent important issues from being brought to public attention.
Main Themes: Distrust in government and health authorities
Importance of public scrutiny and transparency
Notable Quotes: The right to FREE SPEECH outweighs the so called risks this Bill will try to combat.

Some of these theories are now being proven correct, so if they were taken down before people had a chance to read them, then there would not be a democratic voice to be able to question these theories.
